channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Best new board game apps of 2020
item.description: The best board gaming action… on your phone or computer.

item.title: TV Technica 2020: Our favorite shows and binges in a year of living distantly
item.description: With most major movie releases sidelined until 2021, TV stepped in to fill the gap.

item.title: Wonder Woman 1984 is fun, but doesn’t quite capture magic of its predecessor
item.description: Patty Jenkins' sequel is hampered by nonsensical plot, heavy-handed moralizing

item.title: Study: children’s belief in Santa Claus is more nuanced than you think
item.description: Santa falls into an ambiguous category between “real” and “nonreal” for many children

item.title: 2020’s 20 most-commented stories
item.description: Yesterday we brought you the most popular stories of 2020. These are the most talked-about.

item.title: Nikola stock craters after cancellation of major garbage truck order
item.description: Nikola has been on the defensive since fraud allegations surfaced in September.

item.title: Poignant The Midnight Sky wrestles with whether humankind is worth saving
item.description: George Clooney directed and stars in adaptation of the Lily Brooks-Dalton novel

item.title: 2020’s 20 most-read stories on Ars Technica
item.description: It’s our annual rundown of the most-read stories.

item.title: Google develops an AI that can learn both chess and Pac-Man
item.description: MuZero handles both rules-based and open-ended games.

item.title: Trump vetoes $740B defense bill, citing “failure to terminate” Section 230
item.description: Congress already scheduled veto override votes for after Christmas.

item.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator in VR: A turbulent start for wide-open skies
item.description: Basic impressions of what to expect—and hopes for patches to come.

item.title: Trump admin. agrees to pay Pfizer $1.95B for 100M more vaccine doses
item.description: Agreement means Pfizer will provide a total of 200M doses, with option for 400M more.

item.title: Musk says Apple passed on Tesla acquisition three years ago
item.description: Tesla got near bankruptcy as it ramped up Model 3 production in 2017 and 2018.

item.title: Samsung’s Galaxy S21 Ultra hits the FCC, confirms S-Pen and Wi-Fi 6E support
item.description: The phone is due out earlier than ever, in mid-January.

item.title: For Biden administration, Fauci’s in, but Birx is not
item.description: Birx was widely seen as too accommodating to Trump but got sidelined anyway.

item.title: Rocket Report: SN9 rolls to the launch pad, SLS “wet dress” test ends early
item.description: “It has surely been a year of challenges.”

item.title: The omnibus bill was packed with energy and environment policy
item.description: DOE gets a long list of clean energy R�D projects.

item.title: Let’s Encrypt comes up with workaround for abandonware Android devices
item.description: When you haven’t been updated since 2016, expiring certificates are a problem.

item.title: Leonardo da Vinci’s drawings have unique microbiomes, study finds
item.description: Research could help slow down deterioration of aging artwork, unmask counterfeits.

item.title: Congress creates new copyright court that could make trolling easier
item.description: Congress also made streaming pirated works a felony.

item.title: Firefox continues cracking down on tracking with cache partitioning
item.description: Mozilla follows Apple’s and Google’s leads on partitioning, then one-ups them.

item.title: Google, Facebook reportedly agreed to work together to fight antitrust probes
item.description: The law doesn’t love it when competitors promise to cooperate in certain ways.

item.title: The 911 Carrera S: Two pedals good, three pedals better
item.description: Porsche designed the 992 around the PDK gearbox; why is the manual so darn good?

item.title: The Apple Watch Series 6 is $60 off at Amazon today
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on tons of video games, wireless headphones, and more.

item.title: SARS-CoV-2’s spread to wild mink not yet a reason to panic
item.description: A monitoring program picked up a single case and no indications of wider spread.

item.title: “America’s doctor,” Anthony Fauci, gets Moderna vaccine
item.description: Fauci was vaccinated alongside NIH director and HHS secretary.

item.title: Reminder: Donate to win swag in our annual Charity Drive sweepstakes
item.description: Help us set a new giving record by adding to our $35,000+ charity haul so far.

item.title: Ars Technica’s best games of 2020
item.description: These 20 titles helped a quarantined 2020 pass by that much more quickly.

item.title: $50-per-month emergency broadband subsidies approved in pandemic stimulus
item.description: Congress creates $3.2 billion fund for people with low incomes or who have lost jobs.

item.title: Russia’s space chief is hopping mad over most recent US restrictions
item.description: “The first thing they did is spit into the Samara well.”

item.title: Yukon gold miner unearths a mummified Ice Age wolf pup
item.description: Look upon the face of an Ice Age predator, and say “Aww.”

item.title: Apple is allegedly working on a passenger car, breakthrough battery tech
item.description: Reuters cites several anonymous sources in this update to Project Titan

item.title: Pornhub squarely targeted in bipartisan bill to regulate sex work online
item.description: The bill would cause more harms to sex workers than it would fix, critics argue.

item.title: Zero-click iMessage zero-day used to hack the iPhones of 36 journalists
item.description: Malicious messages installed spyware that recorded audio and pics and stole passwords.

item.title: What we know about the new SARS strain that’s shutting down the UK
item.description: Policy is to treat it like a potential threat, but the emphasis is on “potential.”

item.title: After riots, iPhone manufacturer says it “deeply regrets” exploiting workers
item.description: Apple flags Wistron for “violations of our Supplier Code of Conduct.”

item.title: AT&T reportedly struggling to sell DirecTV at anything but a huge loss
item.description: AT�T told bidders it may cancel auction if offers don’t improve, NY Post reports.

item.title: These tires work better in snow thanks to 3D printing
item.description: Additive manufacturing helps create 3D “sipes” that open and close as you drive.

item.title: Lost Sega arcade classics born anew in cute, $130 Astro City Mini [Updated]
item.description: Fun, clicky buttons, Sega rarities, and solid emulation—albeit with some issues.

item.title: Russia’s space chief cannot seem to get “gentle” SpaceX out of his mind
item.description: “I wonder if gentle SpaceX is able to work in such conditions?”

item.title: Review: Alice in Borderland takes us down a deliciously bonkers rabbit hole
item.description: Alice in Wonderland and Ready Player One meet Lord of the Flies and Cube.

item.title: Humanity is in danger of becoming obsolete technology in LX 2048
item.description: Director Guy Moshe chats with Ars about his ambitious sci-fi film.

item.title: How an obscure British PC maker invented ARM and changed the world
item.description: 1987’s Acorn Archimedes was the first production RISC-based personal computer.

item.title: Russia’s hacking frenzy is a reckoning
item.description: US still has no good answer for “supply chain” attacks that let Russia run wild.

item.title: Car crashes killed 36,096 people in the US in 2019
item.description: Urban pedestrian and cyclist deaths have risen over the last decade.

item.title: Kazakhstan spies on citizens’ HTTPS traffic; browser-makers fight back
item.description: Kazakhstan gov required citizens to install self-signed root certificate.

item.title: The 15 best films of a bizarre (and probably historic) year for film
item.description: Some good 2020 news: Most of our favorite films this year can now be enjoyed from home.

item.title: Second COVID vaccine approved for use in the US
item.description: More vaccines will help ease shortages, work through priority list.

item.title: Wildfire smoke is loaded with microbes. Is that dangerous?
item.description: Researchers want to study potential effects of microbe-filled haze on human health.

item.title: A clever strategy to deliver COVID aid—with satellite data
item.description: Togo used image analysis algorithms to target economic support for most vulnerable.

item.title: Miyamoto leads fans through Super Nintendo World—and it looks incredible
item.description: Nintendo, Universal Studios went all out to deliver a Nintendo-fan destination.

item.title: Microsoft may be developing its own in-house ARM CPU designs
item.description: Bloomberg’s unconfirmed report relies on confidential sources within Microsoft.

item.title: Stanford hospital erupts in protest after vaccine plan leaves out residents [Updated]
item.description: Only 0.5% of the medical residents at Stanford are in on the first round of shots.

item.title: Some Big Sur users are unable to update macOS due to an MDM bug
item.description: A bug in Mobile Device Management is causing major headaches for some users.

item.title: US government bans tech exports to top drone maker DJI
item.description: Chinese smartphone firms Huawei and ZTE have been on the list for several years.

item.title: Greenland is as much a love story as an epic spectacle of impending disaster
item.description: Director Ric Roman Waugh on bringing hope and humanity to a harrowing tale.

item.title: Law banning “rental” fees for customer-owned routers takes effect Sunday
item.description: New law also targets hidden cable-TV fees and lets users cancel without penalty.

item.title: NOAA expects La Niña weather patterns through March
item.description: Here’s last month’s summary and the outlook for the next three.

item.title: Biomarkers are how cancers give up their secrets
item.description: An animated look at the evolving science behind modern oncology.

item.title: Finger-pointing abounds as states get fewer vaccines than planned
item.description: Pfizer: We have “millions more doses” with no shipping instructions from Feds.

item.title: Back 4 Blood alpha test: Building decks, killing zombies, having co-op fun
item.description: Design director says he’s learned from Evolve—and fun, familiar co-op combat checks out.

item.title: Why racing drivers trust their lives to a fireproof fabric called Nomex
item.description: Today’s gear is lighter, brighter, more comfortable to wear, and protects longer.

item.title: Battery prices have fallen 88 percent over the last decade
item.description: Cheaper batteries are making it easier to fight climate change.

item.title: Rocket Report: Angara finally flies again, Falcon 9 customers embrace reuse
item.description: “We’ve fallen below the number of staff we feel we require.”

item.title: Microsoft president calls SolarWinds hack an “act of recklessness”
item.description: Of 18,000 backdoored servers, hackers followed up on only a few dozen.

item.title: Sony delists PlayStation version of Cyberpunk 2077, offers refunds to all owners [Updated]
item.description: Follows abysmal performance issues on base PS4; Xbox offers refunds, doesn’t delist.

item.title: Microsoft is reportedly added to the growing list of victims in SolarWinds hack
item.description: Other reported victims include the Energy Department nuke security administration.

item.title: Moderna vaccine gets the thumbs-up for emergency use
item.description: A daylong meeting results in a decisive vote: 20 for, none against.

item.title: Jeremy Bulloch, the original Boba Fett, has passed away
item.description: News confirmed by the actor who played childhood Boba in prequels.

item.title: Google committed “antitrust evils,” colluded with Facebook, new lawsuit says
item.description: The AGs of 52 US states and territories are joining the feds to sue Google.

item.title: Tesla Cybertruck Hot Wheels toy ships late—just like real Tesla cars
item.description: Elon Musk can’t be blamed for this production delay.

item.title: SolarWinds hack that breached gov networks poses a “grave risk” to the nation
item.description: Nuclear weapons agency among those breached by state-sponsored hackers.

item.title: Twitter repeals retweet roadblocks, Facebook follows suit
item.description: Both Twitter and Facebook are winding down some temporary emergency measures.

item.title: Google kills Android Things, its IoT OS, in January
item.description: Google promised three years of updates at launch but stopped updates after one year.

item.title: Looking into the genetics of severe COVID-19
item.description: Genetics may underlie some of the variability in people’s symptoms.

item.title: “Simp,” “incel” part of newly banned insults on Twitch
item.description: New policies also tighten restrictions on sexual harassment, hateful content.

item.title: MindGeek: The secretive owner of Pornhub and RedTube
item.description: Porn is everywhere, but the company that owns the most popular sites is out of sight.

item.title: China collects Moon samples, may not share with NASA due to Wolf Amendment
item.description: The country returned about 2kg of rocks from the Moon’s surface.

item.title: Amazon’s answer to SpaceX Starlink delivers 400Mbps in prototype phase
item.description: Amazon offers peek into development of antenna for Project Kuiper user terminal.

item.title: Don’t try this at home: George’s Marvelous Medicine is quite toxic
item.description: Roald Dahl’s classic children’s story proved “remarkably accurate” about toxic effects.

item.title: “Evil mobile emulator farms” used to steal millions from US and EU banks
item.description: Scale of operation is unlike anything researchers had seen before.

item.title: As the world quieted down in 2020, Raspberry Shakes listened
item.description: Humble Raspberry Pis helped scientists track the seismic noise people stopped making in 2020.

item.title: HBO Max patches its Roku hole six months after launch
item.description: Adds over 100 million potential users; follows deals for PlayStation 5, Amazon Fire.

item.title: Qualcomm promises three years of Android updates for its entire SoC lineup
item.description: The new plan is three years of major OS updates and four years of security updates.

item.title: Google bought CloudReady, the largest ChromiumOS distribution
item.description: Google says it will continue to offer the free-as-in-beer Home edition.

item.title: What makes The Expanse so great: Good science, balancing epic with personal
item.description: Ars chatted with showrunner Naren Shankar and writers Daniel Abraham and Ty Franck.

item.title: Up to 3 million devices infected by malware-laced Chrome and Edge add-ons
item.description: Security firm identifies 28 malicious extensions hosted by Google and Microsoft.

item.title: 40 GirlsDoPorn victims sue Pornhub for hosting “sex trafficking” videos
item.description: Pornhub owner “knew GirlsDoPorn was trafficking its victims,” lawsuit alleges.

item.title: Google sees major services outages two days in a row
item.description: Some users are still reporting problems, especially if they use a third-party client.

item.title: Astra set up a rocket launch with five people and came within seconds of orbit
item.description: “It’s a really nice Christmas present for the team.”

item.title: Bitcoin price passes $20,000, setting new record
item.description: The value of the world’s bitcoins is around $380 billion.

item.title: Reminder: Donate to win swag in our annual Charity Drive sweepstakes
item.description: Join hundreds of readers who have donated over $23,000 so far.

item.title: FDA authorizes use of a nonprescription home COVID test
item.description: Test works with a cellphone app that can alert local health authorities.

item.title: FDA releases data on Moderna’s COVID vaccine: It looks good [Updated]
item.description: Data drop comes ahead of a potential Emergency Use Authorization on Thursday.

item.title: Uber defends sexual assault victims’ privacy, gets fined $59 million
item.description: Victim rights group RAINN said Calif. request risks “re-traumatization of victims.”

item.title: Apple’s watchOS 7.2 is out, offers new health and fitness metrics
item.description: Apple’s health-monitoring claims go far beyond those from typical fitness gear.

item.title: iPhone factory workers say they haven’t been paid, cause millions in damages
item.description: Dramatic video shows employees smashing windows in response to pay disputes.

item.title: The Super-est SuperFX: An unmodified SNES, revved up with ray tracing [Updated]
item.description: FPGA board adds real-time RT effects, “sticks to the broad spirit of ’90s technology.”

item.title: Alan Tudyk plays a crime-solving alien in disguise in Resident Alien trailer
item.description: Syfy series is adapted from the Dark Horse comics by Peter Hogan and Steve Parkhouse.

item.title: The Orion spacecraft is now 15 years old and has flown into space just once
item.description: It was supposed to be the beginning of the Mars era.

item.title: Senator tries to block Frontier’s FCC funding, citing ISP’s various failures
item.description: Senator: Frontier mismanaged previous funds and shouldn’t get new gigabit money.

item.title: Canada set to raise carbon price considerably over next decade
item.description: Plan extends price trajectory to CAN$170 per ton by 2030.

item.title: CDPR admits it “ignored the signals” of Cyberpunk 2077’s console issues
item.description: Refund requests are dependent on console/retailer policies, CDPR says.

item.title: Pinterest agrees to $22.5 million settlement in discrimination lawsuit
item.description: Settlement is one of the largest ever in this kind of case, Brougher’s lawyer said.

item.title: The Google Home Max is dead—Google shuts down production
item.description: The Home Max was $400. It weighed 12 pounds. It was probably too expensive.

item.title: Modern Vintage Gamer talks dev details and hardware hackery
item.description: Maker, breaker, emulator co-developer, YouTuber—MVG’s been around the block.

item.title: EU warns that it may break up Big Tech companies
item.description: Repeat offenses under new rules will trigger action to force divestments.

item.title: The Audi R8 V10 performance: They won’t make them like this much longer
item.description: A mild midlife facelift does nothing to dampen our enthusiasm for the R8.

item.title: SolarWinds hackers have a clever way to bypass multi-factor authentication
item.description: Hackers who hit SolarWinds compromised a think tank three separate times.

item.title: Twenty years later, Dungeons & Dragons gets another movie adaptation
item.description: Co-director clinches a Freaks � Geeks full-circle conclusion.

item.title: FTC kicks off sweeping privacy probe of nine major social media firms
item.description: Consumer privacy has fallen into the FTC’s purview, so it’s digging deep.

item.title: SpaceX won “rural” FCC funding in surprising places, like major airports
item.description: Starlink and other ISPs took advantage of broken FCC system, researcher says.
